Description: Rim sherd of East Greek pottery bowl; dull cream slip; interior painted black with superimposed red band lined in white and further white traces near rim; exterior: painted decoration consisting of undetermined floral motif, very worn; incised inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The slip suggests this is a Chian vase, though the shape is not typical of Chian production.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.26)
